div.p: ACHIEVE an IMPORTANT AIM with DIFFICULTY.
1. The general word for succeeding is 達 (ant. qiǒ2ng 窮 "get nowhere, have no way out") refers quite simply to "making it".
2. Tōng 通 (ant. kùn 困 "run into trouble, get into trouble") refers to the achievement of unimpeded progress in what one is trying to do.
3. Jī 幾 (ant. jiǒng 窘 "get into a hopeless position") refers to an almost complete success.
4. Jí 及 refers to the successful reaching of a high level.
5. Dé yì 得意 (liǎo dǎo 潦倒 "end up in a hopeless position") refers to the full achievement of one's highest ambitions or hopes.
6. Yù 遇 (ant. bù yù 不遇 "fail to succeed") refers to success under certain specific circumstances or by chance.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: Bibliographisches Handbuch zur Sprachinhaltsforschung. Teil II. Systematischer Teil. B. Ordnung nach Sinnbezirken (mit einem alphabetischen Begriffsschluessel): Der Mensch und seine Welt im Spiegel der Sprachforschung

sense.def: succeed in the contextually determinate matter N
be successful; be fully up to one's job
to succeed in (doing), to be fit to (do)

entry.def: Jí 及 refers to the successful reaching of a high level.

sense.def: get to the important point, succeed in what one should do or is setting out to do
get as far as V-ing, succeed V-ing, manage to V
to be managed to be VERBED: 可及止
get to the point of; come up to, be as good as, reach the same level as
succeed in doing the contextually determinate thing

entry.def: Jī 幾 (ant. jiǒng 窘 "get into a hopeless position") refers to an almost complete success.

sense.def: just about succeed, just about achieve one's ends; be near-perfect
get close to success (in an undertaking)
cause (oneself) to succeed in> get one's way with
have (one's way N1) with (a ruler etc N2) 得之其主
consider Nab to be successful, to have been a success
to succeed; end successfully, be a success
be successful in things; achieve things successfully
succeed in V-ing, get to V
succeed with the contextually determinate matter N
get one's way through skilful action
succeed in V-ing; manage to V
succeed in the matter (the Way etc)
be a success with, have success with (superiors etc)
get properly established and succeed in one's career
cause (someone) to succeed LY: 立仁
take a successful stand; be an intellectual success
get well-established in the place N
the becoming well-established, successful establishment of a career
lead to the desired end, Danish: foere frem; reach perfection
get to the stage of V-ing, reach the stage of V-ing; do one's utmost to V
cause to get to the ultimate point, cause to get to the point of perfect realisation; perform completely what one is trying to do
to become acceptable, to succeed, to prevail

entry.def: Tōng 通 (ant. kùn 困 "run into trouble, get into trouble") refers to the achievement of unimpeded progress in what one is trying to do.

sense.def: make a success of oneself; succeed, win through

entry.def: The general word for succeeding is 達 (ant. qiǒ2ng 窮 "get nowhere, have no way out") refers quite simply to "making it".

sense.def: succeed, win through; reach one's destination; succeed in one's career
succeed in, be successful in connection with
cause to succeed 自達 "cause oneself to succeed"

entry.def: Yù 遇 (ant. bù yù 不遇 "fail to succeed") refers to success under certain specific circumstances or by chance.

sense.def: succeed under the circumstances; happen to succeed; "make it"
have success with, become a success with; hit it off with
realise one's aspirations; get what one wants, succeed in one's ambitions

entry.def: Dé yì 得意 (liǎo dǎo 潦倒 "end up in a hopeless position") refers to the full achievement of one's highest ambitions or hopes.

sense.def: succeed, get one's will, achieve one's purpose
become a reasonable success, have decent prospects
become a reasonable success, have decent prospects

form.pron: dé dé de děi qí zhì

sense.def: achieve one's purpose; reach one's aims
"bear fruit", be efficiently successful as intended
